channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ Karlsruhe Institute of Technology on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: Advancing Open-Set Domain Generalization Using Evidential Bi-Level Hardest Domain Scheduler
item.description: EBiL-HaDS, a novel adaptive domain scheduler, significantly boosts open-set domain generalization by strategically sequencing training domains based on model reliability assessments.

item.title: Provably Safe Neural Network Controllers via Differential Dynamic Logic
item.description: Verifiably safe AI controllers are created via a novel framework, VerSAILLE, which uses differential dynamic logic and open-loop NN verification to prove safety for unbounded time horizons.

item.title: The Minimax Rate of HSIC Estimation for Translation-Invariant Kernels
item.description: Researchers found the minimax optimal rate of HSIC estimation for translation-invariant kernels is O(n‚Åª¬π/¬≤), settling a two-decade-old open question and validating many existing HSIC estimators.

item.title: Variational Distillation of Diffusion Policies into Mixture of Experts
item.description: VDD distills complex diffusion policies into efficient Mixture of Experts (MoE) models via variational inference, enabling faster inference and improved performance in behavior learning.
